N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6500.5 - Matching fund requirement

State Regulations
(a) The award recipient's match obligation is
reflected in the schedule below: (1)

In year
one of the award, for each dollar of State assistance payment made to the award
recipient for a reimbursable expense, the award recipient is required to
demonstrate one dollar of match. (2)

In year two of the award, for each dollar
of State assistance payment made to the award recipient for a reimbursable
expense, the recipient is required to demonstrate 1.25 dollars of
match. (3)

In year three of the
award, for each dollar of State assistance payment made to the award recipient
for a reimbursable expense, the recipient is required to demonstrate 1.5
dollars of match. (4)

In year four
of the award, for each dollar of State assistance payment made to the award
recipient for a reimbursable expense, the recipient is required to demonstrate
1.75 dollars of match. (5)

In year
five of the award, for each dollar of State assistance payment made to the
award recipient, the recipient is required to demonstrate 2.0 dollars of
match. (b) Where the
period of the award is less than five years, the match commitment will increase
in accordance with the schedule set forth in subdivision (a) of this section
until the end of the term. For example, the award recipient's match commitment
in year three of a three year award would be in accordance with paragraph
(a)(3) of this section--1.5 dollars of match for each dollar of State
assistance. Notes
